page.title: 03Employment In South Kyme
page.content: In the past the majority of people worked on local farms, but today, due to the cut-back in employees, this number has fallen considerably, especially among women. Some cottages, once 'tied' to the farms, have been sold to private owners, introducing a variety of occupations. Several people travel out to work in offices, clothing and food factories, garages, shops & teaching. A number of people are unemployed and depend upon State Benefit for their income. Farmworkers relations with their employers are reasonable & some workers belong to the Transport & General Worker's Union. Employment for school leavers is scarce, causing many to travel daily, or move away for training or jobs. There are several retired people, some are newcomers who have bought homes here.
